snippet: Smartphone apps that use the Internet to send text messages are forcing wireless providers to change pricing models.
abstract: Smartphone apps that use the Internet to send free text messages are forcing wireless providers to change pricing models and could cost them tens of billions of dollars in lost revenue; shift is opening opportunities for big companies like Facebook and Apple, as well as smaller start-ups, which are making aggressive grabs for the market.
lead_paragraph: Smartphone apps that use the Internet to send text messages are forcing wireless providers to change pricing models.

headline.seo: Free-Messaging Apps Siphon Profits from Cellular Providers
headline.main: Apps Redirect Text Messages, and Profits, From Cellular Providers
headline.print_headline: Apps Redirect Text Messages, and Profits, From Cellular Providers
